alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Harlan and Letcher. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cumberland, Lynch, Benham, Lewis Creek, Partridge, Maggard, Big Black Mountain, Blair, Rock House, Clover, Oven Fork, Eolia and Clover Fork.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
